Title:
Taxonomic reconsideration of Tricholoma foliicola
(Agaricales, Basidiomycota) based on basidiomata morphology, living
culture characteristics, and phylogenetic analyses
Keywords:
Arthroconidia, Basidiospores, Gerhardtia, Lyophyllaceae,
rDNA phylogeny
Abstract:
“Tricholoma foliicola” was taxonomically reconsidered.
Basidiomata of T. foliicola sampled in this study fruited on the humus
or leaf litter in their habitat, which suggested their saprotrophic
status. Basidiospores of T. foliicola specimens including holotype were
ellipsoid with irregular outline with a cyanophilic reaction.
Phylogenetic analyses on internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region and
large subunit (LSU) 28S region of fungal nuclear ribosomal RNA (nrRNA)
genes demonstrated that T. foliicola is the species of Gerhardtia also
characterized by irregular shaped basidiospores. Thus, we transferred
this species from Tricholoma to Gerhardtia. Cultured mycelia of G.
foliicola on malt extract agar medium were characterized by producing
cystidia covered with granules and abundant formation of thallic conidia
(arthroconidia) with both schizolytic and rhexolytic secession.
